definition: boring/of no interest
(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: I feel to do rubbish to stand, gain bit of penny, uninteresting.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得做垃圾站吧，赚点小钱，没意思。

sentences.english: " Answer of is still that words" a breaks the temple, a few bodhisattva, dull.
sentences.chinese: “回答的还是那句话”一座破庙，几尊菩萨，没意思。

sentences.english: Jem decided there was no point in quibbling and was silent.
sentences.chinese: 杰姆觉得跟他磨嘴皮子没意思，于是便不再做声了。

sentences.english: If people cannot see the ball come-and-go between players, it is not funny.
sentences.chinese: 如果人们不能看着球在运动员中传递，那就没意思了。

sentences.english: I feel stupid of just repeating it.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得重复这个有点儿没意思。

sentences.english: Riding my bike or skating alone was no fun.
sentences.chinese: 骑自行车或滑旱冰也变得没意思了。

sentences.english: I think it is very dull, without any real sense.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得它很没意思，一点现实感都没有。

sentences.english: Too boring, and thanks to my grandmother to stay home with me.
sentences.chinese: 太没意思了，幸亏我奶奶在家陪我。

sentences.english: I don't enjoy being with you. We don't have any fun anymore.
Han always feels like she has had a boring weekend.
sentences.chinese: 但韩女士还是觉得周末很没意思。

sentences.english: B: But I think football is boring. Football just isn’t my thing.
sentences.chinese: 但是我认为足球没意思，我对足球不感兴趣。

sentences.english: Itwouls dull or boring to go out to dinner with a poor costskdined.
sentences.chinese: 和鄙吝鬼一起出门吃饭真没意思。

sentences.english: They make the same mistakes, so uncreative.
sentences.chinese: 他们总在犯同样的错误，太没意思了。

sentences.english: But even so, Ms. Han always feels like she has had a boring weekend.
sentences.chinese: 但韩女士还是觉得周末很没意思。
